title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 16.6 - Reissuance of plates
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 16.6 - Reissuance of plates

State Regulations
(a) A special number plate for which the validation has expired, but which plate
has not been surrendered to the department, shall not be reissued until one
year after its last stated expiration date. (b) Except as provided in section
16.7
(b) of this

Part, a special number plate which has been surrendered to or replaced by the
department shall not be reissued until one year from: (1)
the expiration of the first year of the
two-year registration period if the plats is surrendered or replaced within the
first year; or
(2)
the expiration
of the second year of the two-year registration period if the plate is
surrendered or replaced during the second year. However, if the plate is requested by the person who had
such plate replaced by the department or who surrendered the same, such plate
may be reissued immediately, provided that the plate is available for issuance. This subdivision shall not apply to plates in reserved series, which may be
reassigned immediately. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
16.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
